==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=kun|みず|そこ}}
Compound of {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=みずそこ}} elements {{compound|lang=ja|sort=みずそこ|水|tr1=mizu|t1=water|底|tr2=soko|t2=bottom}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|み|ずそこ}}<ref name="DJR"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[mizɯᵝso̞ko̞]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|みずそこ}}

# the [[bottom]] or [[bed]] of a [[body of water]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|み|そこ|k2=ぞこ|r=y}}
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|み|そこ}}
Compound of {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=みなそこ}} elements {{compound|lang=ja|sort=みなそこ|水|tr1=mi|t1=water|な|tr2=na|pos2={{etyl|ojp|-}} possessive particle|底|tr3=soko|t3=bottom}}.<ref name="KDJ"/><ref name="DJR"/>

Sometimes also read as ''minazoko''. {{rendaku2|sort=みなぞこ|soko|zoko}}<ref name="KDJ"/>

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|み|なそこ}}<ref name="DJR"/><ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{ja-accent-common|h|み|なぞこ}}<ref name="DJR"/><ref name="NHK">{{R:NHK Hatsuon}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[mina̠so̞ko̞]|[mina̠zo̞ko̞]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|みなそこ}} {{ja-altread|hira=みなぞこ}}

# the [[bottom]] or [[bed]] of a [[body of water]]

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=on|すい|てい}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=すいてい}} compound {{m|ltc|水底|tr=sywijX *děi|lit=water bottom}}. Compare modern {{cog|cmn|水底|tr=shuǐdǐ}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|音読み|On'yomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|す|いてい}}<ref name="DJR"/><ref name="NHK"/>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[sɯᵝite̞ː]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|すいてい}}

# the [[bottom]] or [[bed]] of a [[body of water]]

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-l|水底線|すいていせん|suiteisen}}: an [[underwater]] [[cable]], such as on the [[seabed]] or a [[riverbed]]
* {{ja-l|水底植物|すいていしょくぶつ|suitei shokubutsu}}: a [[benthophyte]]: a [[plant]] that grows on the [[bed]] of a [[body of water]]
